page.title: 04Decline of Holiday Industry.
page.content: Gorleston has declined in importance in recent years, partly due to the erosion of much of it's fine beach in the late 1960s, and also because of changing holiday patterns. Fewer people now are inclined towards guest house and hotel accomodation, more preferring caravan and self catering flats or holiday camps. Elmhurst, the only such camp within Gorleston, was closed in the early 1970s. Since Gorleston has never provided a very wide range of evening entertainment comparable to that to be found in Yarmouth, the increasing problem of reaching the latter through heavy traffic in the evening has also deterred holiday makers from staying in the town.
